criteria_summary: Five cards with the same rank which are not all the same suit.
Five cards of any rank that all share the same suit.
Five cards with the same rank and same suit.
Three cards with the same rank, and two cards with the same rank, all from a single suit.
Four cards with a matching rank. Suits may be different.
Three cards with a matching rank and two cards with a different matching rank, with cards from at least two or more suits.
When no other hand is possible, the one highest card in your hand. Aces are counted high for this hand.
Two cards with a matching rank. Suits may be different.

A Straight Flush that contains an Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and 10 on the same suit. (For most purposes, such as hand levels, number of hands played for Obelisk and Supernova and hands for The Eye and The Mouth, this is equivalent to a Straight Flush.)
Five cards with ranks that are in consecutive order. Suits may be different. Aces can be counted as high (A K Q J 10) or low (A 2 3 4 5), however, not at the same time (K A 2 3 4 is not valid).
Five cards in consecutive order that all share the same suit.
Three cards with a matching rank. Suits may be different.
Two cards with a matching rank and two cards with a different matching rank. Suits may differ.
